sn22.9:4.2: “Mendicants, form of the past and future is impermanent,
sn22.9:4.4: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past form,
sn22.9:4.5: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future form,
sn22.9:4.6: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of present form.
sn22.9:4.14: Consciousness of the past and future is impermanent,
sn22.9:4.16: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about past consciousness,
sn22.9:4.17: doesn’t look forward to enjoying future consciousness,
sn22.9:4.18: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of present consciousness.”
